bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence [Walter L.] Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 10, 1900

div1.p: Lawrence Reed expresses excitement about receiving his commission. He is assigned to the 10th Infantry in Cuba and fears he will not be able to visit home. Lawrence wants his father to send him a sword.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence [Walter L.] Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 10, 1900
div1.opener:
Do pardon my mistakes
this time, L.
Santa Clara Batty,
Aug. 10th 1900.
div1.p:
Well dearest mother, I suppose you
can guess how pleased and happy I
am that at last I have received my
commission- Yes the long wait is
all over and I am just beginning anew
We had heard all kinds of rumors
but they all seemed to be groundless, The first
we heard came Wednesday, when we
saw in the Army Register of the
appointments and assignments but as
we heard nothing more that day we
concluded that the good news would come
in on the Saturdays boat, but it was
better than we expected, yesterday about
1 p.m. I was sitting in my room I
heard Capt Harmon come in the
office and even then I had no Idea
what he was up to, after he had been
there about 20 minutes he called me
and from then for about 2 hours
I dont remember what I was did
except that I filled out all kind
of blanks and that Lt Hamilton
signed my Oath of office. Later on in the
afternoon I moved over to the officers quarters
and after supper I went out to Quemados
and saw the Starks.

When I got up this morning the Capt
asked me to put on my uniform and told me
that I might do duty here until I received my
orders so, this morning I mounted the guard
and am officer of the day already. So you
see it has been quite a change for me, I
went down town this morning and got a few things
that I needed and have spent the rest of the day
quietly at home, of course I have been dignified
to beat the band I guess that's the reason I have
had a headache.

Now for the future, I have been assigned
to the 10th Infantry, and they are stationed in
Cuba, so I guess its more than probable
that I will get orders to join as soon as
possible, so I have given up all hope
of coming home yet awhile. If I find that
I will be able to come home. I will let you
know in ample time, so if you dont hear you
can mark my visit off your list, of
course I am sorry but not at all
unhappy that is for the present-
I am glad to say that Hunter
was assigned to the 10th it will
make it real nice for us both.
Saw Beilce Barden this morning
he is looking fine. by the way
Sophia Stuart is up at the Summit
have you seen her, Lt B said he
was trying to persuade Mrs. Barden
to go up there for a month or so,
Until you hear from me address
your letters to Santa Clara Batty and
if I have left they will be forwarded
to me,

Ask father if he will select
and send to me a good sword
and send it to me here at Santa Clara Batty, tell him to
get a good one to cost just about
what he said it would and address
it in care of the Q transport service
at New York and that I will send
him the cash for it. If he can't get
one in Washington to order it from
Henry V. Allien & Co, 734 Broadway, N.Y.
well dearest I will close, but will write
you again Sunday. Best love for all
and hoping I will be able to come home
if only for ten days or so I am your AffSon
div1.closer:
Lawrence.
Senders Mail
WL Reed.
2 Lt. 10th Inf'y.
